fields_of_interest: Culture, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Youth, Research and innovation, Digital economy and society
industry_forums: ELIG is a Member of European Internet Forum (EIF) Intergroup
inter_groups: ELIG is occasionally invited to the IMCO Working Group (WG) on the Digital Single Market (DSM)
eu_initiatives:
ELIG is monitoring EU policies in the domains of: 
 
* 21st century skills, youth and inclusion 
* digital creativity and fostering entrepreneurship 
* open education 
* technology enhanced learning
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
ELIG maintains a number of partnerships 
http://www.elig.org/we-are/partnerships/
relevant_communication:
ELIG supports bottom-up innovation in European education and learning. For this purpose, we partner with many European partners e.g. in organizing learning formats - such as the Classroom of the Future at the Frankfurt Bookfair.  
 
ELIG organizes yearly conferences as a European series that has already been conducted in Helsinki, Stockholm, London, Berlin and Paris engaging over 1,000 European learning and education stakeholders in partnership with national institutions and initiatives. 
 
ELIG issues a regular number of reports and publications including the ELIG Emerald Book Series 
„Advances in Digital Education and Lifelong Learning“.
goals__remit:
Founded in 2002, ELIG (The European Learning Industry Group) is an open alliance of companies and institutions of the education sector who pursue a joint mission to support the digital transformation of European learning and education. 
 
ELIG has created in 2016 the ELIG Foundation gGmbH as a nonprofit organization to support the ELIG mission and innovation activities. The ELIG Foundation gGmbH can draw on a creative team of learning innovators, project managers, organization scientists, technologists, journalists, designers or architects as well as on the full network of ELIG and its members. Our work is based on a humancentric design approach to education in a digital society that includes aspects such as building 21st 
century skills, pedagogical innovation or new learning space design.
